title: Proclamation: Constitution Week, 2025
summary: A presidential proclamation designates Constitution Week and commemorates the 238th anniversary of the signing of the U.S. Constitution. The proclamation describes the Constitution as the foundational framework for the nation's system of self-government and urges the American people to reflect on constitutional principles, engage in civic education, and participate in activities that recognize the document's role in American governance.

title: Memorandum of Understanding Between the Government of the United States of America and the Government of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland Regarding the Technology Prosperity Deal
summary: This memorandum of understanding formalizes bilateral cooperation between the United States and the United Kingdom focused on science and technology capabilities and standards, with the aim of advancing innovation and supporting freedom and prosperity for future generations. It expresses a mutual interest in coordinating on technology policy and capabilities under a formal agreement between the two governments to pursue collaborative initiatives related to technology prosperity.

title: Establishment of an Emergency Board to Investigate Disputes Between the Long Island Rail Road Company and Employees Represented by Labor Organizations
summary: The President announced the establishment of an Emergency Board under the Railway Labor Act to investigate disputes between the Long Island Rail Road Company and certain of its employees represented by labor organizations. The board will receive information, hear from the parties, and issue findings and recommendations intended to facilitate a prompt and peaceful resolution. The disputes involve multiple labor organizations, including the Transportation Communications Union, the Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers and Trainmen, the Brotherhood of Railroad Signalmen, and the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers, as well as other employee organizations representing Long Island Rail Road workers. The action aims to prevent service disruptions and support a rapid settlement through formal inquiry and guidance.

title: Executive Order Extending the TikTok Enforcement Delay Under the Protecting Americans from Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act
summary: This executive order extends the enforcement delay previously established by section 2(a) of Executive Order 14166, dated January 20, 2025, which applies the Protecting Americans from Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act to TikTok. Section 1(a) describes the extension of the enforcement delay referenced in EO 14166. The order is issued under the President's constitutional and legal authority and continues measures related to restrictions on foreign adversary controlled applications as authorized by the Act, consistent with national security considerations.

title: Nominations Sent to the Senate for United States Attorneys
summary: Announcement of presidential nominations to the Senate for United States Attorneys across multiple districts. The nominees listed are William Boyle for the Eastern District of North Carolina (four-year term), Erin Creegan for the District of New Hampshire (four-year term), and Zachary Keller for a United States Attorney position in Louisiana (four-year term). The White House states that these nominations have been sent to the Senate for consideration, with the publicly reported excerpt partially listing the districts.

title: Proclamation Honoring the Memory of Charlie Kirk
summary: A presidential proclamation honoring the memory of Charlie Kirk and directing that the flag of the United States be flown at a specified level of display as part of the national observance.
